r24595 | ezust | 2017-01-20 19:25:22 +0100 (Fri, 20 Jan 2017) | 2 lines

changelog.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r24594 | vampire0 | 2017-01-20 15:39:59 +0100 (Fri, 20 Jan 2017) | 9 lines

The plugin manager now uses a different URL scheme where the mirror is a URL
parameter and not part of the hostname anymore and follows URL redirection
properly. This way a file can always be downloaded as we get redirected to a
mirror that has the requested file available. Now dead mirrors do not cause
the download to fail anymore due to unknown hostname and files that are only
available on few mirrors (seldom downloaded files are only available on one
mirror sometimes) also work properly. The selected mirror is just the
preferred one that is used if the file is available there, just as the label
always suggested anyway.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r22807 | kerik-sf | 2013-02-20 19:20:47 +0100 (Wed, 20 Feb 2013) | 10 lines

Insert_Buffer_Properties.bsh is UTF-8 - bug #3311234

Macros can't be assumed to be all UTF-8.
They have always been read using platform's default encoding
so it's not changed to not break user's macros.

The only core macro with non ascii is Insert_Buffer_Properties.bsh
I add a buffer-local-property encoding=UTF-8 to remove a warning
on windows, where it's not UTF-8 by default, but it works only
for people having the autodetector active.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r22806 | kerik-sf | 2013-02-20 19:02:26 +0100 (Wed, 20 Feb 2013) | 8 lines

buffer-local-property encoding detector in users guide

The user guide is not in sync with services.xml, which calls
the buffer local properties detector buffer-local-property.
It advertises the name buffer-local-properties, which results in
  AutoDetection: getEncodingDetectors(): No EncodingDetector
  for the name "buffer-local-properties"
error.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r21885 | k_satoda | 2012-06-27 16:06:58 +0200 (Wed, 27 Jun 2012) | 7 lines

Dropped the artificial limitation to 1024 chars on expanding the gap
in ContentManager. Now it always use the complete remaining buffer which
is expanded in a geometric progression. This change greatly speeds up
big search&replace-all operations in which case copying in moveGapEnd()
exhibited quadratic operation. Now it is amortized linear.
(Patch #3533838 by Thomas Meyer, tweaked by me)

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r21884 | k_satoda | 2012-06-27 15:53:47 +0200 (Wed, 27 Jun 2012) | 4 lines

Avoided unreasonable memory consumption by duplicate String instances
that could be allocated for each occurrence in a big search&replace-all.
(Patch #3528619 by Thomas Meyer)

r21813 | k_satoda | 2012-06-17 08:14:13 +0200 (Sun, 17 Jun 2012) | 5 lines

Removed redundant inKillRing field from UndoManager.RemovedContent. It
seemed to be held for performance, but the time complexity is linear
with or without it. It was rather an overhead about memory and code
complexity. (SF.net patch #3531538)

r21812 | k_satoda | 2012-06-17 07:56:30 +0200 (Sun, 17 Jun 2012) | 3 lines

A small correction of r21811, which accidentally changed a behavior.
(SF.net patch #3531538)

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r21811 | k_satoda | 2012-06-17 07:47:47 +0200 (Sun, 17 Jun 2012) | 6 lines

Removed redundant hashCode field from UndoManager.RemovedContent. It
seemed a workaround for a performance problem in a very old JVM
implementation. Now, java.lang.String can cache its hash code in it, and
major JVM implementations do that since over a decade ago.
(SF.net patch #3531538)

r21810 | k_satoda | 2012-06-17 07:32:35 +0200 (Sun, 17 Jun 2012) | 4 lines

Removed redundant length fields from UndoManager.Insert/Remove. They
were always equal to the length of the strings which are held as another
field. (SF.net patch #3531538)

r21302 | k_satoda | 2012-03-10 10:18:21 +0100 (Sat, 10 Mar 2012) | 16 lines

Made localized .props file to be in UTF-8 so that they can be edited
directly without escaping non ISO-8859-1 characters.

Existing files were migrated as follows:
  - Convert all existing escapes into the original characters
    represented in UTF-8.
    #!/bin/sh
    for PROPS in *.props; do
      native2ascii -encoding ISO-8859-1 $PROPS >$PROPS.ascii
      native2ascii -reverse -encoding UTF-8 $PROPS.ascii >$PROPS
    done
  - Replace trailing spaces in values into "\u0020" not to be stripped
    accidentally in the future.
  - Remove all other trailing spaces in comments or empty lines.
  - Set ":encoding=UTF-8:".

------------------------------------------------------------------------

r21259 | k_satoda | 2012-03-07 15:51:23 +0100 (Wed, 07 Mar 2012) | 10 lines

Made basic edit operations aware of characters above BMP and combining
character sequences. (SF.net bug #3040720)

Specifically, the fixed operations are caret movements, selection,
delete, and backspace. Many other derived operations which use caret
positions or selection ranges also became safe unless the offsets were
altered by programs which are not aware of above mentioned characters.

Direct buffer operations are not in scope of this fix.

r21213 | k_satoda | 2012-02-26 16:14:49 +0100 (Sun, 26 Feb 2012) | 8 lines

Reduced the calls to layoutGlyphVector() in case of the font
substitution logic found a character which can't be displayed with the
main font, and also with substitution fonts. Before this change, it
could be called for every single character.

further tweaks easier without worry of this kind of problem.

font will be".

The problem was reported in SF.net patch #3488967, but the fix was
restructured by me to be fairly readable.

r21190 | k_satoda | 2012-02-23 17:36:27 +0100 (Thu, 23 Feb 2012) | 8 lines

Eliminated quadratic iteration in
DisplayTokenHandler.recalculateTabWidth() which could choke CPU when
wrapping very long lines.

If a line consists of 1000 chunks and the line is wrapped at every
second chunk, the iteration goes roughly 998 + 996 + ... + 2 = 249500
times.

r21037 | daleanson | 2012-02-01 17:16:43 +0100 (Wed, 01 Feb 2012) | 5 lines

Fixed some edge use cases:
1) selecting to the start of the next line after the line of the last variable would cause the macro to fail or cause the unselected variable declaration on the next line to be included.
2) if comments were selected as part of the variables to create get and set methods, the macro would fail.
3) if variable declaration spanned more than one line the macro would fail.
4) if more than one variable was created on the same line and were initialized, the macro would fail.

r20775 | kpouer | 2012-01-13 22:12:35 +0100 (Fri, 13 Jan 2012) | 18 lines

Better way to paste multiple files to VFS Browser

- New constructors for CopyFileWorker:
  CopyFileWorker(Component comp, VFSFile[] vfsFiles, String target)
  CopyFileWorker(Component comp, VFSFile[] vfsFiles, String target, 
  			Behavior behavior)
  CopyFileWorker(Component comp, File[] files, String target)
  CopyFileWorker(Component comp, File[] files, String target, Behavior behavior)
  to allow copy of multiple files at the same time

  copy(ProgressObserver progress, VFS sourceVFS, Object sourceSession,
  	String sourcePath, VFS targetVFS, Object targetSession,
  	String targetPath, Component comp, boolean canStop,
  	boolean sendVFSUpdate)
  copy(ProgressObserver progress, String sourcePath,String targetPath, 
  	Component comp, boolean canStop, boolean sendVFSUpdate)

r19987 | Vampire0 | 2011-09-20 03:31:45 +0200 (Tue, 20 Sep 2011) | 7 lines

Rewrite the build system

- Use Ivy for retrieving almost all dependencies, making it possible to check out source and just do "ant" to build jEdit without the need of additional downloads or properties being set. Only for things that need to be installed, which is InnoSetup for building the windows installer and wine, if InnoSetup should be used on a system other than Windows, need to be installed and setup manually in build.properties.
- Use ant-contrib tasks for better readable and understandable build file and more performant builds with using contrib:runtarget where possible.
- Use Ivy to pull in bundled plugins from plugin central.
- Use saxon for documentation to be able to pull in a system independent XSLT processor with Ivy.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Added a bug fix

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r19698 | shlomy | 2011-07-23 14:22:01 +0200 (Sat, 23 Jul 2011) | 7 lines

Avoid a deadlock when multiple files are dragged into jEdit.
The problem was that the transfer handler invoked multiple "jEdit.openFile" in worker threads.
jEdit.openFile takes the bufferListLock during the loading, and eventually needs to send an EditBus message on the EDT.
If the EDT somehow needs the bufferListLock (e.g. saving the perspective) during this loading, there's a deadlock:
The EDT waits for the work thread to release the bufferListLock, and the work thread is waiting for the EDT (to send the EditBus message).
The current fix is simply to run jEdit.openFile in the EDT.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r19697 | shlomy | 2011-07-23 13:26:51 +0200 (Sat, 23 Jul 2011) | 3 lines

Fixed bug #3374207: Wrong mode detection on drag and drop from GNOME Commander
The problem was that gnome-commander adds a trailing 0-byte after the file name. This extra 0-byte caused the filename regexp of the mode to not match the filename.

r19488 | kpouer | 2011-03-25 18:14:39 +0100 (Fri, 25 Mar 2011) | 52 lines

- New methods JEditBuffer.setContextInsensitive(boolean) and
  JEditBuffer.GetContextInsensitive() to manage the new attribute
  contextInsensitive of JEditBuffer. By default it is set by the
  edit mode, but you can change it's value (careful, it can break
  the syntax highlight of your buffer if you don't know what you do) 
  (Matthieu Casanova)
  
  - New property for the edit modes : contextInsensitive.
  By default the value is false, but if set to true the color highlight of
  a line of the buffer do not depends on the previous line. It works of course
  only for modes that do not have multiline comments and no tokens that can be
  on several lines (like literal in several languages)
  This cause major performances improvement on buffers that use an edit mode
  that is context insensitive.
  The following modes are now context insensitive :
  assembly-agc
  assembly-ags
  assembly-m68k
  assembly-mcs51
  assembly-parrot
  assembly-r2000
  assembly-x86
  awk
  cobol
  csv
  csv-commits
  eiffel
  foxpro
  hex
  htaccess
  hxml
  icon
  ini
  jmk
  json
  mqsc
  outline
  props
  ptl
  pvwave
  rfc
  rib
  rpmspec
  sip
  splus

r19386 | kpouer | 2011-02-24 12:06:57 +0100 (Thu, 24 Feb 2011) | 14 lines

Entire word search rewritten :
now the search is done as usual, then before returning the result it is checked to be a whole word, if not, the next result is searched (and checked).

A whole word has the following conditions :
 
 start of word :
 beginning of the line
 starts with a symbol or space
 char before the first char is a symbol or space
 
 end of word:
 end of line
 ends with  a symbol or space
 char next to the last char is a symbol or space

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r18557 | kpouer | 2010-09-14 10:05:17 +0200 (Tue, 14 Sep 2010) | 12 lines

Ability to change cursor of the textarea

Added methods to manage the cursor if the TextArea :
  In the TextAreaPainter class, added
  resetCursor()
  setCursor(Cursor)
  The cursor behavior is the following :
  when the cursor is the default one : TEXT_CURSOR,
  when typing text it is hidden, after moving the mouse it reappears.
  If a plugin calls setCursor() to replace it for whatever reason,
  the cursor will not disappear anymore when typing or be changed to 
  TEXT_CURSOR until resetCursor() is called
------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r17492 | daleanson | 2010-03-18 05:42:11 +0100 (Thu, 18 Mar 2010) | 1 line

Adjusted the ModeProvider so it is a little smarter in picking the mode for a file. It is possible for a file to match more than one mode. Previously, the first mode that would accept the file was selected as the mode for the file. This change checks a little more, so a mode that matches both the filename glob and the first line glob will be selected before a mode that matches only the filename glob. If no mode matches both filename glob and first line glob, then a mode that matches the filename glob will be selected before a mode that only matches the first line glob. This is particularly useful for xml files, so that Ant build files can be differentiated from jEdit actions.xml files and from regular xml files.  Regardless of file name or first line globs, user modes will be selected before global modes.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r17491 | daleanson | 2010-03-18 05:22:30 +0100 (Thu, 18 Mar 2010) | 1 line

The documentation for how to write an edit mode says that "if an edit mode in the user-specific catalog has the same name as an edit mode in the system catalog, the version in the user-specific catalog will override the system default."  This change makes this statement true.

Add new option to perform font substitution in the text area.

This will cause the text rendering code to choose appropriate
fonts to display characters the current font can't. It's off
by default, and can be turned on along with a list of preferred

. make the FontSelectorDialog class public so it can be

. small change to clean the font cache in the Chunk
  class was added to TextArea.java.

r17235 | elberry | 2010-02-08 03:23:52 +0100 (Mon, 08 Feb 2010) | 1 line

Adding version check to "Create Plugin Announcement" macro. This will show a warning to users creating a plugin release announcment when their plugin's requirements for jEdit, and other plugins don't match what they have installed. Eg. If the user is creating a plugin ann. for a plugin requiring jEdit 04.03.18.00, and they are running jEdit 04.03.99.01, the warning will show. Likewise, if the user creates an ann. for a plugin that requires ProjectViewer 2.9.0, but they are using 2.9.3 the warning will show. User's can always click "Yes", or hit enter on the dialog window to create the ann. anyway.

r16805 | daleanson | 2010-01-01 20:33:37 +0100 (Fri, 01 Jan 2010) | 1 line

Fix for 2924261, BufferLocal ignores request to change encoding.  The problem isn't that BufferLocal ignores the request, the problem is that the encoding property is never set on the buffer before it is closed, so BufferLocal is never notified that the user wanted it changed.  This change sets the encoding prior to closing the buffer, so the proper EditBus message is generated, so BufferLocal is notified.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fixed a comment typo.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r16591 | shlomy | 2009-12-02 22:09:17 +0100 (Wed, 02 Dec 2009) | 2 lines

Fixed bug #2907139: Upgrading from 4.2final to 4.3pre18 causes freeze at startup
The freeze was caused by an NPE while restoring the view's split configuration, because the buffersets feature changed both the format of the split config string and also created a new section in the perspective file for the specification of the buffers to open on startup. The new section does not exist in old perspective files, so the buffers are not opened automatically before reading the split config, and restoring the split config expected them to be open (with the buffersets feature).

r16473 | vanza | 2009-11-12 07:32:01 +0100 (Thu, 12 Nov 2009) | 7 lines

Modify the EditBus so that it can dispatch messages just to handlers interested in the specific message being sent.

Summary: handler method is annotated with special annotation provided by the EditBus class; signature of the method defines what messages will be delivered to it. More details in the javadoc.

This should make EBMessage handling code cleaner since there's no more need to do "instanceof" to figure out the type of the message being delivered.

Nothing changes in the behavior for existing EBComponent objects.

r16266 | shlomy | 2009-10-03 15:37:43 +0200 (Sat, 03 Oct 2009) | 2 lines

TokenMarker.markTokens should be synchronized, as it is used (indirectly, from Buffer.markTokens) by various plugins as well, such as SyntaxHelper and TaskList.

r16264 | shlomy | 2009-10-03 08:29:29 +0200 (Sat, 03 Oct 2009) | 3 lines

Started fixing issues reported by FindBugs.
EditServer & TipOfTheDay: Random().nextInt() can return Integer.MIN_VALUE, in which case "Math.abs()" retains the negative value.
BufferChanging: getStackTrace().toString() returns the string representation of the stack trace object itself, which is not human-understandable (it is mostly a handle number). To get the string representation of the stack trace elements, need to use Arrays.toString(getStackTrace()).

r16133 | shlomy | 2009-08-31 23:07:15 +0200 (Mon, 31 Aug 2009) | 3 lines

Fix for patch #2846169: IndentFoldHandler - allow blank lines after start of fold
The previous patch did not work correctly, because the folding code in jEdit assumed that a content change in a line cannot affect the fold levels of the preceding lines. Hence, it did not recalculate the fold levels of the preceding lines, and did not update the fold markers accordingly. The patch for the indent folding mode gives whitespace-only lines the same fold level as the first non-whitespace-only line following them, so it breaks this assumption, since a change to a line can affect the fold level of preceding whitespace-only lines.
This commit fixes the assumption by adding a new method to the fold handler for returning the fold levels of preceding lines. Whenever the fold level of a line is changed, this new method is called and the fold levels of the preceding lines get updated correctly. By default, this method does not return anything so no overhead (almost) is added.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r16129 | shlomy | 2009-08-31 01:06:46 +0200 (Mon, 31 Aug 2009) | 3 lines

Applied a modified version of patch #2846169: IndentFoldHandler - allow blank lines after start of fold.
The change is to try to take the fold level of whitespace-only lines from the next non-whitespace line, so that empty lines at the beginning of a fold are considered part of the fold.
The modification from the patch is that the recursion has been replaced with an iterator.

r15699 | shlomy | 2009-07-15 23:21:30 +0200 (Wed, 15 Jul 2009) | 2 lines

Attempt to fix bug #2817321: Exception on startup.
This bug was caused by a back-incompatibility introduced by BufferSets. Previously, the perspective.xml file specified the split configuration by means of buffers (there was a single global buffer-set, shared by all edit panes). BufferSets changed the format of the split configuration to include a specification of buffer-sets, and the split is now specified by means of buffer-sets.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r15681 | shlomy | 2009-07-10 10:40:35 +0200 (Fri, 10 Jul 2009) | 2 lines

Hopefully fixed the restoring of views from the saved perspective for dual-monitor environments. A previous bug fix I made was meant to solve the case where a user moves from a dual-monitor setup to a single monitor setup, with the same settings directory, in which case if a view was previously on the second monitor, its startup location will be outside the single monitor, thus it won't be on the screen.
My previous fix used GraphicsEnvironment.getMaximumScreenBounds, which only returns the bounds of the current display. For dual-monitor setups, this is not sufficient, need to iterate all the devices to find the bounds.

r14918 | shlomy | 2009-04-12 21:58:23 +0200 (Sun, 12 Apr 2009) | 2 lines

Fixed my previous *incorrect* fix for #2744708. If the underlying file of a buffer is deleted, the buffer should be marked both "new" and "dirty". Marking it dirty sends the BufferUpdate.DIRTY_CHANGED edit bus message if needed, and this notifies BufferTabs and the buffer switcher that the buffer status changed so they can update their icons.
The current change fixes an earlier *incorrect* fix that was meant to change only the MD5 calculation in this case but unintentionally prevented the buffer from being marked dirty.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r14889 | shlomy | 2009-04-02 19:03:22 +0200 (Thu, 02 Apr 2009) | 2 lines

Fixed bug #2609091: Windows appear out of view
When loading the view location and size from perspective.xml, check that the view bounds are inside the screen, and if not, fix them. Such cases can happen, for example, if a user worked in a dual monitor environment, where the view was in the 2nd monitor, and then restarted jEdit in a single monitor environment. The coordinates of the view in this case will be outside the single monitor boundaries, and the view will be hidden if not corrected.

r14857 | shlomy | 2009-03-27 13:51:18 +0100 (Fri, 27 Mar 2009) | 2 lines

Fixed the handling of "single interval" selection mode in the filtered list model.
In this mode, any call to "setSelectionInterval" removes all previous selections, keeping only the current one. Using "setSelectionInterval" for each item thus leaves only the last item selected.

r14854 | shlomy | 2009-03-26 23:12:55 +0100 (Thu, 26 Mar 2009) | 1 line

r14853 | shlomy | 2009-03-26 23:10:50 +0100 (Thu, 26 Mar 2009) | 2 lines

Fixed bug #2712031: Index out of bounds exception in FilteredListModel
The list selection is saved at the beginning of setFilter, in order to restore it after changing the list (by filtering). But the selection isn't explicitly cleared, so in case the items selected were filtered out, the selection won't be changed, leading to selection of non-existent indices.

r14805 | shlomy | 2009-03-20 15:08:15 +0100 (Fri, 20 Mar 2009) | 3 lines

(Hopefully) Fixed bug #2671628: perspective.xml not saved on exit
The startupDone vector is used to find out when all views have been laid out. The DockableLayoutSetter class is used to defer layout of all views loaded from perspective.xml to the AWT thread. Each instance lays out a different view, and marks in the startupDone vector when done. This was done in order to eliminate false dependencies between the various setters, but the index provided to each layout setter was based on the view count, which, in rare situations may be incorrect.
Changed the index to use the number of items in the startupDone vector, protecting it with "synchronized" to ensure no two instances get the same index.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Calling visit(SetCursorVisitor) sets the cursor on the editPane, and setting the text cursor on the editPane is incorrect since this will cause the text cursor to be set on the bufferswitcher, and the gutter and scrollbars of the text area.  Using the default cursor
is the right thing to do, this will set the proper cursor on the subcomponents.

Implemented the care for firstTime flag in
PatternSearchMatcher#nextMatch() as defined in javadoc.

The lack of this care had caused many problems; SF.net bugs #1541009,
#1671312, #2069249, #2173091, and some infinite loops caused by zero
width regex replace.

This replaces some previous fixes for above bugs, including addition of
SearchMatcher#isMatchingEOL().

r13875 | daleanson | 2008-10-15 06:29:59 +0200 (Wed, 15 Oct 2008) | 6 lines

added a check for properties for the buffer mode.  Auto-indent is now only done when the mode supports any of the various auto-indent properties, specifically these properties:

"indentOpenBrackets", "indentOpenBrackets", "unalignedOpenBrackets", "unalignedCloseBrackets", "indentNextLine", "unindentThisLine", "electricKeys", "doubleBracketIndent", "lineUpClosingBracket"

If any of these properties are supported by the mode, then auto-indent will be performed.

r13654 | k_satoda | 2008-09-12 21:16:45 +0200 (Fri, 12 Sep 2008) | 10 lines

Removed the internal modifier key state which had caused inconsistent
behaviors occasionally after switching application (or window) focus.
(SF.net bug #2093501, #1650718)

The state was maintained by listening KEY_PRESSED and KEY_RELEASED
events. But the KEY_PRESSED events are not always followed by
KEY_RELEASED. For example, press ALT, click another window (this can be
another application or a floating dockable), and release ALT on that
window.

r13464 | vanza | 2008-08-31 02:59:47 +0200 (Sun, 31 Aug 2008) | 5 lines

SF Bug #2053299: ProjectViewer 2.9: Confused about symlinks

It's not really PV who is confused, but combination of VFS reading the link before the real path, and the symlink loop detection code being way too strict. The loop detection logic should only be applied when resolving symlinks; symlinks that point to other directories in the same tree but don't form a loop can be safely traversed.

This causes the traversal to return more data than before in certain cases, but it's returning the correct data given the user's filesystem.

r13341 | shlomy | 2008-08-16 22:34:48 +0200 (Sat, 16 Aug 2008) | 4 lines

Removed the association between a view's persistence in perspective.xml and its layout file. The layout file is produced and read by the docking framework for each view according to the view index, removing the need for an association in the perspective file. This way, when the docking framework is switched, we can use the previous layout file that was created for the view by the framework to which we switched.
Also, the saving and loading of named layouts no longer requires a perspective file in a separate directory; only the framework directory is needed. The list of named layouts to create dynamic actions for is now taken from the framework, ensure that we don't create dynamic actions for layouts saved in other frameworks.

Also, added some handling of plugin update messages on the edit bus, though this is highly experimental at this stage, sort of a copy of the former implementation.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r13259 | shlomy | 2008-08-10 22:54:46 +0200 (Sun, 10 Aug 2008) | 9 lines

Merging my docking_framework branch back into the main trunk. This adds a few new features to the jEdit core:
1. A pluggable docking framework, which can be provided as a service by plugins. To choose the docking framework, use Global Options -> Docking. The original jEdit dockable window manager is named 'Original'. If you get the MyDoggyPlugin plugin, you can select between Original and MyDoggy.
2. Named perspectives - you can now save the docking layout in a file, and load it any time later from a file. Also, once you save the layout in a file, you get an action that loads the layout from this file, and you can bind this action to a keyboard shortcut or toolbar button just like any other action. The actions to load/save the layout are available through the View->Docking menu, and the action set for keyboard shortcuts or toolbar buttons is named "Docking layouts" (in Global Options dialog).
3. Mode-specific perspectives - you can associate the docking layout with an edit mode, each edit mode having its own layout. You can have jEdit automatically save the layout of an edit mode when you switch to another, and automatically load the layout of an edit mode when you enter the mode. The auto load/save of mode-specific layout can be set using Global Options -> Docking.

Implementation-wise, several major changes were done to support a pluggable docking framework:
1. Management of toolbars and split configuration (of edit panes) is managed entirely by the core - the docking framework is unaware of it. The framework just gets a panel to be used as the center component, and the core sets its contents with the split configuration and the toolbars when needed.
2. The docking layout has been abstracted out of ViewConfig, and is now delegated to the docking framework for persistence.
3. A new DockingLayoutManager class listens to edit bus messages and responds to edit mode changes by saving/loading the docking layout if the appropriate options are set.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r13049 | k_satoda | 2008-07-14 21:14:57 +0200 (Mon, 14 Jul 2008) | 20 lines

Made "Close (local)" as the default action to close a buffer because it
is more natural action than current "Close" which affects to inactive
editpanes or views.

Here is the summary of changes.

From:
  action "editpane-close-buffer" label "Close (local)"
  action "close-buffer" label "Close"
To:
  action "close-buffer" label "Close"
  action "global-close-buffer" label "Close (global)"

And also, an API name is changed to match with the action name;
From
  jEdit.removeFromBufferSet(EditPane, Buffer)
To:
  jEdit.closeBuffer(EditPane, Buffer)
  // This is an overload for jEdit.closeBuffer(View, Buffer)

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r13048 | k_satoda | 2008-07-12 16:58:16 +0200 (Sat, 12 Jul 2008) | 3 lines

patch #1608486 because the latter makes the feature configurable.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r13045 | vanza | 2008-07-11 08:48:37 +0200 (Fri, 11 Jul 2008) | 3 lines

Another tweak to deep indent: the current code could get confused when the code had lots of intertwined parenthesis (for example, several embedded function calls inside a conditional spanning several lines).

To avoid this confusion, keep data to match opening and closing parenthesis when parsing the lines. This way the code can know for sure what is the unmatched parenthesis and its position, and then do the proper alignment.

r12692 | k_satoda | 2008-05-22 19:08:52 +0200 (Thu, 22 May 2008) | 7 lines

Restored the reverse feature of SegmentCharSequence to keep binary
compatibility, but deprecated the feature in favor of
ReverseCharSequence which covers more of the methods of CharSequence.

The problem was reported by kpouer on jedit-devel. It did break the
Highlight plugin and some more codes.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r12691 | kpouer | 2008-05-22 15:34:47 +0200 (Thu, 22 May 2008) | 1 line

minor change and documentation
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r12690 | k_satoda | 2008-05-21 22:04:22 +0200 (Wed, 21 May 2008) | 6 lines

Moved the reverse feature of SegmentCharSequence to a new class
ReverseCharSequence. This is better not only for performance of each
call to charAt() but also for completeness of CharSequence interface.
SegmentCharSequence didn't support subSequence() and toString() for
reversed sequence.

r12529 | vanza | 2008-05-01 06:47:58 +0200 (Thu, 01 May 2008) | 1 line

Minimize the creation of new string instances when processing data from the buffer. New strings require copies of the data to be made - the new approach uses a CharSequence implementation that provides most of the same functions as a String, but is backed by the same data used internally by the buffer - so no copying.

r12486 | k_satoda | 2008-04-20 06:31:57 +0200 (Sun, 20 Apr 2008) | 12 lines

Changed the behavior when a file could not be loaded due to strict error
about encoding. The file is now loaded permissively. This makes it
possible to fix the error by editing and saving, and to guess what type
the file actually is.

This change requirs adding a method to the interface Encoding, assuming
no one, but jEdit core itself, implements it for now.

Following is the related mailing on jedit-devel.
http://www.nabble.com/Re%3A-jEdit---file-encodings-td16482966.html
http://www.nabble.com/RFC%3A-Permissive-reload-on-encoding-error-%28was%3A-jEdit---file-encodings%29-td16622694.html

Improved PHP edit mode (Daniel Hahler):
  - handle "${foo}" (SF Bug 1818619) and other valid expressions in literal,
    backticks and heredoc blocks
  - fix comment props for HTML in TAGS ruleset (C-e C-c/range-comment uses
    proper comment syntax there now)

    ruleset; includes fixed handling of comments
  - fix matching of PHP vars (using SEQ_REGEXP instead of MATCH_FOLLOWING),
    so that it does not match "$foo\" completely; now uses the exact regexp
    for valid variable names
  - add ruleset PHP_COMMENTS (re-factored)

- It was colored as MARKUP while %r notations and "(/regexp/" are
  colored as LITERAL3.
- In "(/regexp/", "/"s were colored as OPERATORs. It is hard to find
  if it is the form "(/#{exp}/".

r10963 | k_satoda | 2007-10-29 20:45:24 +0100 (Mon, 29 Oct 2007) | 13 lines

Dropped the following classes from API. They are just implementation
details of the core. Users can use more abstract base classes or
interfaces instead of them.
  - org.gjt.sp.jedit.JEditMode
  - org.gjt.sp.jedit.JEditRegisterSaver
  - org.gjt.sp.jedit.JEditRegistersListener
  - org.gjt.sp.jedit.bufferio.JEditKillRing

Most of the classes became package private. JEditKillRing was moved
into org.gjt.sp.jedit to be consistent with similer classes which have
the prefix "JEdit". Also, killring.dtd was moved to org/gjt/sp/jedit
because it is tightly coupled with JEditKillRing.

r10600 | shlomy | 2007-09-20 02:29:28 +0200 (Thu, 20 Sep 2007) | 7 lines

Fixed bug 1796916: Dockables sometimes become blank when floated
The bug turned out to be much simpler than I thought; the dockables are made
invisible by their PanelWindowContainer before they are floated.
Somehow, making the floating JFrame visible also makes the dockable window
inside them visible, sometimes not. Forcing them into visible state fixes
the issue.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r10438 | ian_davis | 2007-08-24 18:18:08 +0200 (Fri, 24 Aug 2007) | 10 lines

SF patch #1780421:  Mac thread safety on file open

Fixes a thread-safety issue that often hangs jEdit when opening files using
Mac machinery -- i.e. the Finder, drag-n-drop on the Dock icon, or the "open"
tool from the command line.

The problem was that Delegate.applicationOpenFiles(NSApplication, NSArray)
tried to open files from AWT-AppKit thread instead of AWT-EventQueue.  The only
way to recover was to Force Quit jEdit and restart it.

r9876 | ezust | 2007-06-28 23:26:56 +0200 (Thu, 28 Jun 2007) | 3 lines

Documented the use of newly added (re) prefix to disable translation into globs.


------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9871 | Vampire0 | 2007-06-28 18:33:20 +0200 (Thu, 28 Jun 2007) | 2 lines

Glob translation to regexes got a new feature. If you start a glob now with the sequence "(re)" this prefix is discarded and the remaining string is interpreted unchanged as regex. If you need a glob starting with "(re)" you have to escape it and write "\(re)" instead. So now you can use EVERYWHERE a glob is expected a normal regex instead and use their full power.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9454 | k_satoda | 2007-04-18 16:53:24 +0200 (Wed, 18 Apr 2007) | 14 lines

Establishes an interface EncodingDetector and makes it a new service in
ServiceManager.

Previously provided autodetections (BOM and XMP-PI) are still provided
as builtin services. This offers a way to add new encoding
autodetections like Python, HTML, emacs, ... as a part of a plugin.

This change replaces r8853: option for encoding autodetection from
buffer local property syntax. This autodetection is also provided as a
named service "buffer-local-property". Adding it to new option
"encodingDetectors" in [General] option pane enables this autodetection.

Originally posted as SF.net patch #1698783.

- Fixed some invalid mode files
- Updated some mode files that were still in jEdit 4.0 syntax
- HASH_CHAR in mode-files is now optional and multicharacter
- HASH_CHARS got invented for mode-files as alternative to HASH_CHAR,
  whereby HASH_CHARS lists possible first characters of the matched
  result literally
- Fixed some wrong documentation and added some new
  about HASH_CHAR and HASH_CHARS
- Deprecated some of the ParserRule.createXXX() methods which accepted
  only one character HASH_CHAR, while introduced new ones that accept
  whole Strings. Additionally new ones for accepting HASH_CHARS got
  added.

r7491 | vanza | 2006-10-11 09:08:14 +0200 (Wed, 11 Oct 2006) | 5 lines

Fix the PrintStream implementation used as stdout/stderr to properly handle the new printf() method in Java 5; printf will call "write()" on the underlying output stream several times for the same message, which would case jEdit to break down a single-line message into lots of small messages, making them unreadable.

Also, "just in case", make the output stream synchronized.

- in build.xml, allow overriding whether deprecation is on or off from the build.properties file.

r6809 | vanza | 2006-08-27 03:28:13 +0200 (Sun, 27 Aug 2006) | 10 lines

- fix bug #1543889: "Return value for Beanshell snippet" problem
BeanShell was not properly overwriting new methods added with the same signature of old method. 

There were two side-effects of this:

 (i) the first method with a particular name and signature would always be used, forever, even if a new method with the same signature was added. This broke the way the SearchAndReplace class cached the BS snippet used to do the substitution.

(ii) Since the method was still "compiled" and added to the internal list, there would be a slow memory leak.

Fix is to properly compare the signature of the new method with any old method registered with the same name, and get rid of the old method if it matches.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r5327 | ezust | 2006-01-01 19:40:29 +0100 (Sun, 01 Jan 2006) | 19 lines

From: Bertalan Fodor <fodber@freemail.hu>
Date: Sun, 01 Jan 2006 19:36:13 +0100

I desperately need this fix in JARClassLoader. The problem is that jEdit
doesn't store package information in loaded classes, so getPackage()
returns null in classes loaded from JARs. That makes impossible to
include certain libraries.

Try this macro:

c = console.Console.class;
Macros.message(view, c.getPackage().toString());

Anyway, the problem arose from trying to embed multivalent
(multivalent.sf.net), which uses getPackage for some sophisticated
resource loading mechanism.

Bert
